intro: Zingiber cassumunar var. palamauense, commonly known as Palamau ginger, is a rare and indigenous plant species native to the Eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes other economically important spices like ginger and turmeric. The plant is characterized by its narrow, sword-shaped leaves and produces clusters of fragrant, yellowish-orange flowers. Its rhizomes are used in traditional medicine and local cuisines for their aromatic and medicinal properties. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
